channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: ITWS Co-Terminal Program Info Session Scheduled for October 1
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 1, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Attend this session to learn about the Information Technology & Web Science co-terminal program as Dr. Brian Callahan discusses program requirements, the application process, and upcoming deadlines, and also answers questions. This info session is geared toward first- and second-semester seniors, but all students are welcome to attend.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Hold Mechanical Engineering Review October 2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to take part in this virtual session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Attendees can expect to learn how professionals can develop their practice in core mechanical disciplines while being able to customize the program to fit their needs.
item.author: Students

item.title: NSBE/SHPE 46th Annual Career Fair Continues
item.description: Date: Friday, September 27, 2024 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM - Still trying to figure out what you will be doing next summer? Or are you graduating but still not sure where you would like to work? Why not come and see over 150 companies that will be attendance at this year’s Career Fair? It’s still not too late to register via Handshake to attend!
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of Rensselaer’s Fifth Service Day on October 5!
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 5, 2024 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM - RPI Service Day is an event open to all students to give them a chance to spend a few hours helping the community at various local organizations! Alpha Phi Omega, Rensselaer’s co-ed service fraternity, is working closely with the Bicentennial committee to elevate this event and allow all interested students to learn about and help the local community. Free transportation and lunch will be provided.
item.author: Students

item.title: Planning to Graduate This December?
item.description: If you plan to graduate in December 2024 and haven’t completed your degree application yet, the Student Information System (SIS) is now open to apply! The application deadline is Friday, October 11. Please make sure you refer to the Registrar’s Graduation & Commencement webpage for complete details!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Rensselaereum: An Exhibit of 200 Years of RPI History” Opening September 27
item.description: Date: Friday, September 27, 2024 6:00 PM - Tue , March 31, 2025 12:00 AM - An exhibit featuring the work of 14 RPI School of Architecture students will be presented in the windows of the Chasan building in downtown Troy at 405 Broadway. Exhibit opening on September 27 at 6 p.m. and the exhibit will be on display through March 2025.
item.author: Community

item.title: First US Women’s Cyber Team Includes Student from RPI
item.description: The first-ever U.S. Women’s Cyber team has been assembled and is set to compete in Tokyo, Japan on November 11. Among the 12 female students is Elan Smolar Eisenberg, a fourth-year undergraduate student at Rensselaer who is a dual major in computer science and information technology and web science.
item.author: Community

item.title: Heffner Alumni House Parking Lot Closed Through Sunday
item.description: All members of the campus community should note that the parking lot behind the Heffner Alumni House will be closed all week through Sunday, September 29 for Reunion & Homecoming set-up and festivities. Drivers will need to find an alternate parking location.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Researcher Overcomes Portfolio Optimization Limitations with New Approach
item.description: In research recently published, Rensselaer’s Chanaka Edirisinghe, Ph.D., and Jaehwan Jeong, Ph.D., associate professor at Radford University, have developed a data-driven method to improve portfolio selection in the context of high-dimensional, small-sample problem (HDSS), which refers to an investment portfolio with a large number of assets but little historical data, leading to unreliable portfolio optimization and resulting in weak investment performance.
item.author: Community

item.title: Summer 2024 Dean’s Honor List Now Available
item.description: The Dean’s Honor list for Summer 2024 is now available for viewing on the Dean of Students Office webpage. This list is compiled at the end of each semester to recognize undergraduate students who have completed 12 or more credit hours at Rensselaer with a 3.5 grade point average or better for that term.
item.author: Community

item.title: Be a Part of the Annual “Run to Remember” 5K!
item.description: Date: Saturday, September 28, 2024 7:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Brought to the Troy community by RPI AFROTC Detachment 550, this family-friendly, community-wide event is aimed at supporting local veterans as well as current college students. With RPI celebrating its 200th year, we hope the Bicentennial will bring the community together to enjoy this outstanding event. 60% of the event profits made will be donated to the Special Operations Warrior Foundation.
item.author: Community

item.title: Dana Michel’s “MIKE” Coming to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Friday, October 4, 2024 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM - Join EMPAC for “MIKE,” Dana Michel’s experimental, durational choreographic work! Accompanied by an inventory of office items, Michel embarks on a series of tasks subject to interruption and absurd redirection. Follow her performance as she travels through the center’s studio venues and public spaces! For accessibility concerns, please contact us for how we can best accommodate you for this event.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Names Jennifer Wilson Assistant Women’s Hockey Coach
item.description: The Rensselaer women’s ice hockey team has appointed Jennifer Wilson as assistant coach ahead of the 2024-25 season. Wilson, who joins the Engineers bench following six seasons at the helm of Division III Lake Forest College, compiled an overall record of 77-57-10 and a mark of 56-25-7 in Northern Collegiate Hockey Association play during her tenure at Lake Forest.
item.author: Community

item.title: Check Out the Bicentennial Drone Show on September 27!
item.description: Date: Friday, September 27, 2024 8:00 PM - Come to the East Campus Athletic Village at sunset for an unforgettable experience as we take RPI’s legacy to the sky with our Bicentennial Drone Show, which will celebrate RPI’s past, reflect on the present, and look to the future. An RSVP is required.
